intro: Echium rubrum, commonly known as the redweed or common thornweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and wastelands, and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in dense spikes. Echium rubrum is an annual plant that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
